results.title: True Australians
results.creator_credit: R.H. Miller and Western Australian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Golden West Series”.
Filmed in the Jarrah and Karri forests of Western Australia, shows the felling of trees and transport by whim and rail to the mill. Aspects of reafforestation and fire control are also shown. Historically interesting film in light of when it was produced (1948) and the current debate in the year 2000 surrounding the logging of these forests in Western Australia.

group_works.title: The Emergency situation in Africa. Valley of hope
group_works.creator_credit: David Bowen-Jones, Channel 0-28, London Film Productions, UNICEF and BBC

results.title: The Emergency situation in Africa. Valley of hope
results.creator_credit: David Bowen-Jones, Channel 0-28, London Film Productions, UNICEF and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Global report”.
This compilation tape consists of two programs. 1. “Emergency situation in Africa” illustrates the related problems of farming, malnutrition, disease and rural-urban migration in Africa. (22 mins.) 2. “Valley of hope” shows some of the benefits of having a health care worker in a developing country by comparing infant survival in two villages in Colombia; one which has a health care worker and one which doesn’t (30 mins.) “Valley of hope” is also available as an individual title.

results.title: Open to the Sea
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gippsland”.
One of a series of films about Gippsland, which gives an insight into this region and shows the full scope of natural phenomenon. Where the river meets the sea, new designs in environmental geography appear

results.title: Through the Forest
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gippsland”.
One of a series of films about Gippsland, which gives an insight into this region and shows the full scope of natural phenomenon. The Mountain Ash provides food and shelter at all levels. From the forest floor where the lyrebird scavenges to the treetops which provide launch pads for the spectacular sugar gliders

results.title: Down River
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gippsland”.
For some, floods are a disaster, for others a necessary lifegiving event. The quite different ecology of the riverland is explored in this Gippsland Victoria series, which gives an insight into the Gippsland region and the full scope of natural phenomenon

results.title: Le Voyage dans la Lune (A Trip to the Moon)
results.brief_description: Melies’ fantastical vision of life on the moon.

constellations_other.name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes
constellations_other.description: Magic lantern slides were used to entertain and educate audiences in home, theatres and universities. While performers told jokes and fairytales, travelling showmen unveiled exotic locations and scientists revealed the latest discoveries.

results.title_for_label: Le Voyage dans la Lune (A Trip to the Moon)
results.description: One of the first Science Fiction films, this Melies’ short humorously proposes what man discovers when he first lands on the moon. Based on the Jules Verne story, George Melies used his extraordinary cinematic illusions to tell this story of the first voyage to the moon. Made in 1902, this was a visionary film that has come to be recognised as a cinematic masterpiece. Among the many comical set pieces is the famous scene in which a rocket ship crash-lands into the eye of the ‘man in the moon’. This whimsical fantasy is also exemplary in its early depiction of the moon and the possible encounters between humans and worlds beyond our imagining, in our exploration of deep space.
description_for_label: One of the first Science Fiction films, this Melies’ short humorously proposes what man discovers when he first lands on the moon. Based on the Jules Verne story, George Melies used his extraordinary cinematic illusions to tell this story of the first voyage to the moon. This whimsical fantasy is also exemplary in its early depiction of the moon and the possible encounters between humans and worlds beyond our imagining, in our exploration of deep space.

group_siblings.title: L'Eclipse du Soleil en Pleine Lune

results.title: L'Eclipse du Soleil en Pleine Lune
results.brief_description: An aging astronomer invites students to his castle observatory to observe a solar eclipse. Amid the childish pranks of the novice astronomers and the wondrous vision of the eclipse, George Melies, cinema’s great magician, weaves numerous amusing set pieces. Much to the astronomer’s excitement, the sun and the moon flirt with each other as they come together in an astronomical courtship and the sky explodes in a dance of female stars. On earth, the astronomer falls prey to his cheeky students who rob him of his stately dignity, while the heavens smile down on him from above.
